module-format.description: es6 and es6-global are deprecated. Default: commonjs.

suffix-spec.description: Suffix of generated js files. Default: .js. May contain letters, digits, "-", "_" and "." and must end with .js, .mjs or .cjs.

oneOf.description: true to use the package name as namespace, false to not use

analysis.description: The types of analysis to activate. `dce` means dead code analysis, `exception` means exception analysis, and `termination` is to check for infinite loops.

suppress.description: Paths for any folders you'd like to exclude from analysis. Useful for bindings and similar. Example: `["src/bindings"]`.

unsuppress.description: Any specific paths inside suppressed folders that you want to unsuppress. Example: ["src/bindings/SomeBinding.res"].

transitive.description: specify whether transitively dead items should be reported (default: false)

react-jsx-version.title: jsx-version
react-jsx-version.description: backward compatible mode, true means on with the default to be version 1 (the default value is subject to change)

rule-generator.description: The shell command is running in *dev* time, and you generated could should be checked in, the depedency is tracked properly during dev time,example: `{ "name" : "ocamllex", "command" : "ocamllex.opt $in -o $out"}`

build-generator.description: Note that we will add the directory path accordingly

oneOf.description: if files are empty, the build system will populate it automatically. Useful for initial build

slow-re.description: Regex to glob the patterns, syntax is documented [here](http://caml.inria.fr/pub/docs/manual-ocaml/libref/Str.html), for better incremental build performance, we'd suggest listing files explicitly

public.description: Default: export all modules. It is recommended for library developers to hide some files/interfaces

oneOf.description: true means traverse to all subdirs
A _unique_ name for each directory to refer as an internal dependency later

hierachy.description: When true, all subdirs are considered as a whole as dependency

items.description: internal dependencies, if unspecified, all existing listed source files are considered potential dependencies

gentype-specs.description: path to gentype, path resolution is similar to ReScript

react-jsx.description: Whether to apply the [RescriptReact](https://github.com/rescript-lang/rescript-react)-specific JSX PPX transformation.

version.description: Whether to apply the specific version of JSX PPX transformation

module.description: JSX module. Either "react" for React, or (since v11.1) any valid module name to apply a generic JSX transform.

v3-dependencies.description: Build the given dependencies in JSX V3 compatibility mode.

title: ReScript build configuration
description: All paths are required to be in **Unix format** (foo/bar), the build system normalizes them for other platforms internally

version.description: The semantic version of the ReScript library

namespace.description: can be true/false or a customized name

ignored-dirs.description: a list of directories that bsb will not look into

bs-dependencies.description: ReScript dependencies of the library, like in package.json. Currently searches in `node_modules`

bs-dev-dependencies.description: ReScript dev dependencies of the library, like in package.json. Currently searches in `node_modules`

cut-generators.description: Ignore generators, cut the dependency on generator tools

reason.description: ReScript comes with [Reason](http://reasonml.github.io/) by default. Specific configurations here.

gentypeconfig.description: gentype config, see cristianoc/genType for more details

number.description: Default: "+a-4-9-20-40-41-42-50-61-102". Go [here](https://rescript-lang.org/docs/manual/latest/warning-numbers) for the meanings of the warning flags

oneOf.description: Same as warning number but different set

warnings.description: warning numbers and whether to turn it into error or not

ppx-flags.description: PPX macros to pass to compiler. The syntax is package_name/binary, for example: `reason/reactjs_jsx_ppx_3.native`. Currenly searches in `node_modules`

pp-flags.description: preprocessors to pass to compiler. The syntax is package_name/binary, for example: `pp/syntax.exe`. Currenly searches in `node_modules`

js-post-build.description: (Experimental) post-processing hook. bsb will invoke `cmd ${file}` whenever a `${file}` is changed

package-specs.description: ReScript can currently output to [Commonjs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CommonJS), and [ES6 modules](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/import)

use-stdlib.description: (Experimental) whether to use the OCaml standard library. Default: true

external-stdlib.description: Use the external stdlib library instead of the one shipped with the compiler package

bs-external-includes.description: (Not needed usually) external include directories, which will be applied `-I` to all compilation units

reanalyze.description: Configure reanalyze, a static code analysis tool for ReScript.
